title.rendered: Trekking in India – Best Trekking Destinations in India

content.rendered:
[vc_row full_width=”stretch_row_content” el_class=”charTab-nit-guide-pkg headdingg-center” el_id=”popularBox7″ css=”.vc_custom_1610542010415{padding-top: 20px !important;}”][vc_column width=”1/2″][vc_column_text]

Trekking has become one of the most loved outdoor activities in India. This is mainly because there is no dearth of places to explore. From the majestic Indian Himalayas to the ancient western ghats, Nilgiri Mountains and Kanchenjunga ranges, every corner of India holds some mysterious adventure or another. There are all grades of trekking for every type of travellers catering to all age groups! The trails are not just about reaching one destination, it’s about learning the culture, heritage and the way of life in that region. It is truly, in every sense, a wholesome experience and these times will stay very close to your heart.

As said earlier, trekking tourism in India is an experience for someone who loves the great outdoors. Here is a sneak peek into trekking tourism in India according to regions:

Trekking Tourism In North India

Himalayas – The crowning glory of India, beautifies the North Indian region. Ever since access to the Himalayas was proven possible it has been attracting not just travelers and explorers but also sages, philosophers and gods and goddesses themselves! From trekking up to the source of the life-giving ganga river in Gaumukh or exploring the biodiversity of India in one of the numerous national parks and wildlife sanctuaries like valley of flowers or pin Parvati National Park, there is much more to explore for a curious soul.  Trekking in Himachal Pradesh and Uttarakhand Devbhumi are experiences of a lifetime.

Trekking Tourism In South India

South India trekking trails often get overshadowed by the majestic peaks of Himalayas.

[/vc_column_text][/vc_column][vc_column width=”1/2″][vc_column_text]However, there is more to it than just backwaters and beaches. From being home to the western ghats in Kerala, Nilgiris in Tamil Nadu and the iconic hill ranges of the eastern ghats, south India is not far behind when it comes to exhilarating trekking routes. Some of the most popular trekking in South India include the route to the famous Doddabetta Peak, Anamudi Peak, Kolaribetta Peak and Mukurthi Peak. If you are looking to explore the southern India region then there is no better option than going on an exciting trekking trail.

Trekking Tourism In North East India

Tucked away in the northeastern flank of the Indian Himalayas, the wilderness of northeastern India offers spectacular views and scenic untouched beauty waiting to be discovered and explored. Being one of the most untouched regions of India, the rolling hills, green valleys and babbling rivers outlined by the impeccable snow-clad peaks makes trekking here an otherworldly experience. The magnificent Dzukou Valley Trek, magical rhododendron Barsey Trek, Legendary Monpa Trek and the untouched Yambong Singalila Trek take you to the type of trekking routes that seem like straight out of a fairytale book.

Trekking tourism in India is one of the best ways of experiencing the rich diversity and culture this wonderful nation has to offer. Visit the wonderful landscape that will leave a lasting impression in your heart, mind and soul and who knows you may find yourself going on regular treks more often.[/vc_column_text][/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row full_width=”stretch_row_content” el_class=”charTab-nit-guide-pkg headdingg-center” el_id=”holyHeadBox” css=”.vc_custom_1582013530444{padding-top: 20px !important;}”][vc_column][vc_raw_html][/vc_raw_html][vc_tta_tabs][vc_tta_section title=”Ladakh Treks” tab_id=”ladakh-treks”][vc_raw_html][/vc_raw_html][/vc_tta_section][vc_tta_section title=”Garhwal Treks” tab_id=”garhwal-treks”][vc_raw_html][/vc_raw_html][/vc_tta_section][vc_tta_section title=”Kumaon Treks” tab_id=”kumaon-treks”][vc_raw_html][/vc_raw_html][/vc_tta_section][vc_tta_section title=”Himachal Treks” tab_id=”himachal-treks”][vc_raw_html][/vc_raw_html][/vc_tta_section][vc_tta_section title=”Sikkim Treks” tab_id=”sikkim-treks”][vc_raw_html][/vc_raw_html][/vc_tta_section][vc_tta_section title=”Kashmir Treks” tab_id=”kashmir-treks”][vc_raw_html][/vc_raw_html][/vc_tta_section][/vc_tta_tabs][/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row full_width=”stretch_row_content” el_id=”popularBox”][vc_column][vc_column_text]

Trekking Destinations in India

India is a nation rich in a variety of geographical features ranging from plateaus and plains to mountain deserts and deep valleys. All these factors together create a haven for adventure lovers, thrill seekers and people looking to explore this wilderness on foot. Due to the ever-growing popularity of trekking among people of all age groups, every part of India offers impeccable trekking opportunities which is divided by different grades of trekking. It doesn’t matter if you are a beginner or expert, travelling solo or with a group of people, going out in winter, monsoon or summer, there is something for everyone. Here are some of the best trekking destinations in India that deserves to be explored at least once if you haven’t already:

[/vc_column_text][vc_row_inner][vc_column_inner width=”1/6″][vc_raw_html][/vc_raw_html][/vc_column_inner][vc_column_inner width=”1/6″][vc_raw_html][/vc_raw_html][/vc_column_inner][vc_column_inner width=”1/6″][vc_raw_html][/vc_raw_html][/vc_column_inner][vc_column_inner width=”1/6″][vc_raw_html][/vc_raw_html][/vc_column_inner][vc_column_inner width=”1/6″][vc_raw_html][/vc_raw_html][/vc_column_inner][vc_column_inner width=”1/6″][vc_raw_html][/vc_raw_html][/vc_column_inner][/vc_row_inner][/vc_column][/vc_row]
